content: I’m sorry, but this sounds bullshit to me. There are plenty of apps in the App Store that helps you do exactly that, and no rule like this defined in the App Store Guidelines. Isn’t the real reason for rejection is this? Space gives you a replacement icon for your time and attention sucks of choice, whether it’s Twitter, Facebook or Snapchat. Whenever you open that app, you’re presented with a twelve second pause, and the app asks you to breathe. The idea is to help you consciously enter into your social feeds, rather than mindlessly dive in. So basically Space can replaces its icon with the new API in iOS 10.3 to Facebook’s, Twitter’s or Snapchat’s, right? This means you are using icons of well known apps which sounds more reasonable for an App Store rejection than “helping people use their phone less”.
